sen.j: 伊勢田駅（いせだえき）は、京都府宇治市にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, Iseda Station is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Railways.
Iseda Station, located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Railways.
Iseda Station, located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Railways.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ駅。
sen.e: The station has two separate platforms and two tracks which run in opposite directions.
The station has two separate platforms and two tracks that run in opposite directions.
The station has two separate platforms and two tracks that run in opposite directions.

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: The useful length of the platform is for six cars.
The platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.
The platform has a length sufficient to accommodate six cars.

sen.j: 改札・コンコースは地下に、ホームは地上に設けられている。
sen.e: The ticket gates and the concourses are under the ground, the platforms are on the ground.
The ticket gates and concourses are below ground level, but the platforms are at ground level.
The ticket gates and concourses are below ground level, but the platforms are at ground level.

sen.j: 駅入口は両ホームの大和西大寺寄りにある。
sen.e: The entrance is located at each platform, nearer the Yamato-Saidaiji Station of running direction.
An entrance is located at each platform, nearer to Yamato-Saidaiji Station in the running direction.
An entrance is located at each platform, nearer to Yamato-Saidaiji Station in the running direction.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: The automatic ticket gates manufactured by Toshiba are set up.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: The red automatic ticket gate (EG-2000) can treat two tickets collectively when exiting, and accepts PiTaPa/ICOCA cards.
The red automatic ticket gate (EG-2000) can treat two tickets collectively when exiting, and it accepts PiTaPa/ICOCA cards.
The red automatic ticket gate (EG-2000) can treat two tickets collectively when exiting, and it accepts PiTaPa/ICOCA cards.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization situation
Usage conditions
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 表現を他のファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は7,766人。
sen.e: Number of usage is 7,766 people according to the survey on November 8, 2005.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, the station was used by 7,766 people.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, the station was used by 7,766 people.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、87位。
sen.e: This station ranks 87th among whole Kintetsu stations surveyed (323 stations at that time.)
This station ranks eighty-seventh among all the Kintetsu stations surveyed (323 stations at that time).
This station ranks eighty-seventh among all the Kintetsu stations surveyed (323 stations at that time).

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、17位。
sen.e: 17th among stations on Kintetsu Kyoto Line (26 stations including Yamato-Saidaiji Station)
It ranks seventeenth among stations on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (26 stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranks seventeenth among stations on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (twenty-six stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、15位。
sen.e: 15th among Kintetsu stations in Kyoto Prefecture (23 stations)
It ranks fifteenth among the Kintetsu stations in Kyoto Prefecture (23 stations).
It ranks fifteenth among the Kintetsu stations in Kyoto Prefecture (twenty-three stations).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station surroundings
Station surroundings
Station surroundings

sen.j: 駅周辺は住宅街。
sen.e: The vicinity of the station is residential area.
The station is situated in a residential area.
The station is situated in a residential area.

sen.j: 10分ほど歩くと、コリアタウンとして有名なウトロ地区にたどりつく。
sen.e: Utoro district, famous for Korea town, is 10 minutes walk from the station.
The Utoro district, famous for its Korea town, is a ten-minute walk from the station.
The Utoro district, famous for its Korea town, is a ten-minute walk from the station.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月3日 奈良電気鉄道桃山御陵前駅～西大寺（現・大和西大寺駅）間開通時に開業。
sen.e: The station opened on November 3, 1928 as a station of Nara Electric Railway when the line between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (now, Yamato-Saidaiji Station) was opened.
The station opened on November 3, 1928 as a facility of Nara Electric Railway when the line between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (the present-day Yamato-Saidaiji Station) was opened.
November 3, 1928: The station opened as a facility of Nara Electric Railway when the line between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (the present-day Yamato-Saidaiji Station) was opened.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により、近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: The station became one of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of the Kintetsu Railways due to the amalgamation on October 1, 1963.
The station became part of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Railways due to the amalgamation on October 1, 1963.
October 1, 1963: The station became part of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Railways due to the amalgamation.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）6月4日 地下駅舎化。
sen.e: The station-house was situated under the ground on June 4, 1995.
The station house was moved below ground on June 4, 1995.
June 4, 1995: The station house was moved below ground.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa card was made available.
On April 1, 2007, the PiTaPa card became available.
April 1, 2007: The PiTaPa card became available.

sen.e: Ogura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Iseda Station - Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)
